message:
That's an interesting one. I'll update the article properly when I get a chance, but in the meantime, "await Task.Yield();" would have the same effect.

Note that it's *very* rare to have to do this. The only time I've needed asynchronous continuations is when I was writing asynchronous coordination primitives (AsyncLock, etc), and even then I used the flag on TaskCompletionSource, never StartNew.
